abstract: The recent flurry of activity in the energy industry has been helped by high oil prices and China’s demand for energy.
snippet: The recent flurry of activity in the energy industry has been helped by high oil prices and China’s demand for energy.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street has always loved the fees generated by deal-crazy oil companies. But the recent flurry of activity in the energy industry — $130 billion so far this year and counting — is once again making them the most valuable clients for the world’s merger advisers.

headline.main: With Oil Deals, Merger Advisers Rejoice
headline.print_headline: With Oil Deals, Merger Advisers Rejoice

byline.original: By Christopher Swann and Wei Gu

abstract: Peabody Energy raised its bid for Macarthur Coal of Australia to $3.8 billion in cash, calling it a definitive offer, a day after Macarthur rebuffed an improved bid from Peabody’s rival in the takeover attempt, New Hope.
snippet: Peabody Energy raised its bid for Macarthur Coal of Australia to $3.8 billion in cash, calling it a definitive offer, a day after Macarthur rebuffed an improved bid from Peabody’s rival in the takeover attempt, New Hope.
lead_paragraph: Peabody Energy raised its bid for Macarthur Coal of Australia to $3.8 billion in cash Thursday, calling it a definitive offer, a day after Macarthur rebuffed an improved bid from Peabody’s rival in the takeover effort, New Hope.

headline.main: Peabody Lifts Macarthur Bid to $3.8 Billion

abstract: The American International Group remains a long-term investor in the People’s Insurance Company of China, China’s top non-life insurer said on Thursday, even as the embattled U.S. firm unwinds its holdings in other assets to repay the U.S. government, Reuters reported.
snippet: The American International Group remains a long-term investor in the People’s Insurance Company of China, China’s top non-life insurer said on Thursday, even as the embattled U.S. firm unwinds its holdings in other assets to repay the U.S. governm...
lead_paragraph: The American International Group remains a long-term investor in the People’s Insurance Company of China, China’s top non-life insurer said Thursday, even as the embattled American firm unwinds its holdings in other assets to repay the United States government, Reuters reported.

headline.main: P.I.C.C.’s Chief Says A.I.G. Is Committed to Its Stake

abstract: Agricultural Bank of China announced its roster of 10 banks it has picked to handle its initial public offering, which is expected to raise as much as $20 billion, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Agricultural Bank of China announced its roster of 10 banks it has picked to handle its initial public offering, which is expected to raise as much as $20 billion, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Agricultural Bank of China announced the roster of 10 banks it has picked to handle its initial public offering, which is expected to raise as much as $20 billion, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Agricultural Bank of China Announces Underwriters
